Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be.

Author: Marthe Troly-Curtin,  Phrynette Married
Quote: Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time.

Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Diary
Quote: It's so hard to forget pain, but it's even harder to remember sweetness. We have no scar to show for happiness. We learn so little from peace.

Author: Dale Carnegie
Quote: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.

Author: Ernest Hemingway,  The Garden of Eden
Quote: Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.

Author: Frederick Lewis Donaldson
Quote: The Seven Social Sins are: Wealth without work. Pleasure without conscience. Knowledge without character. Commerce without morality. Science without humanity. Worship without sacrifice. Politics without principle.From a sermon given by Frederick Lewis Donaldson in Westminster Abbey, London, on March 20, 1925.

Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Quote: There's nothing like deep breaths after laughing that hard. Nothing in the world like a sore stomach for the right reasons.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV
Quote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
Quote: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.

Author: Anna Pavlova
Quote: When a small child, I thought that success spelled happiness. I was wrong, happiness is like a butterfly which appears and delights us for one brief moment, but soon flits away.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.

Author: Audrey Hepburn
Quote: The most important thing is to enjoy your life—to be happy—it's all that matters.

Author: Charles M. Schulz
Quote: Happiness is a warm puppy.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer
Quote: You cannot protect yourself from sadness without protecting yourself from happiness.

Author: Tom Bodett
Quote: They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: someone to love, something to do, and something to hope for.

Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
Quote: No medicine cures what happiness cannot.

Author: Dale Carnegie,  How to Win Friends and Influence People
Quote: It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it.

Author: George Burns
Quote: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Invisible Monsters
Quote: The only way to find true happiness is to risk being completely cut open.

Author: Marcel Proust
Quote: Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.

Author: Lauren Oliver,  Delirium
Quote: You can't be happy unless you're unhappy sometimes".

Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
Quote: HopeSmiles from the threshold of the year to come, Whispering 'it will be happier'...

Author: Bertrand Russell,  The Conquest of Happiness
Quote: Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Sanity and happiness are an impossible combination.

Author: Tom Bodett
Quote: They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: someone to love, something to do, and something to hope for.

Author: Paul Simon
Quote: I've got nothing to do today but smile.

Author: W.P. Kinsella
Quote: Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.

Author: Jon Krakauer,  Into the Wild
Quote: Happiness [is] only real when shared

Author: Bette Midler
Quote: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.

Author: Orhan Pamuk,  Snow
Quote: Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.

Author: Ayn Rand
Quote: Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Bell Jar
Quote: I felt my lungs inflate with the onrush of scenery—air, mountains, trees, people. I thought, "This is what it is to be happy.

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of Green Gables
Quote: It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.

Author: David Henry Hwang,  M. Butterfly
Quote: I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.

Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Quote: please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.

Author: J.M. Barrie,  Peter Pan
Quote: When the first baby laughed for the first time, its laugh broke into a thousand pieces, and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Kafka on the Shore
Quote: It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a story.

Author: Honoré de Balzac
Quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.

Author: George Washington Burnap,  The Sphere and Duties of Woman: A Course of Lectures
Quote: The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer
Quote: I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.

Author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo
Quote: I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.

Author: Hunter S. Thompson
Quote: So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?

Author: Edward Lear,  The Owl and the Pussycat
Quote: And hand in hand, on the edge of the sand, They danced by the light of the moon.

Author: Charlotte Brontë
Quote: Happiness quite unshared can scarcely be called happiness; it has no taste.

Author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice
Quote: I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve.

Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  Notes from Underground
Quote: Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.

Author: Rita Mae Brown
Quote: One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.

Author: Guillaume Apollinaire
Quote: Now and then it's good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy.

Author: Nikos Kazantzakis,  Zorba the Greek
Quote: I felt once more how simple and frugal a thing is happiness: a glass of wine, a roast chestnut, a wretched little brazier, the sound of the sea. Nothing else.

Author: Betty Smith,  A Tree Grows in Brooklyn
Quote: I know that's what people say-- you'll get over it. I'd say it, too. But I know it's not true. Oh, youll be happy again, never fear. But you won't forget. Every time you fall in love it will be because something in the man reminds you of him.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Quote: It was only a sunny smile, and little it cost in the giving, but like morning light it scattered the night and made the day worth living.

Author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Quote: I'd far rather be happy than right any day.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length.

Author: Katja Millay,  The Sea of Tranquility
Quote: People like to say love is unconditional, but it's not, and even if it was unconditional, it's still never free. There's always an expectation attached. They always want something in return. Like they want you to be happy or whatever and that makes you automatically responsible for their happiness because they won't be happy unless you are ... I just don't want that responsibility.

Author: Gordon B. Hinckley
Quote: Generally speaking, the most miserable people I know are those who are obsessed with themselves; the happiest people I know are those who lose themselves in the service of others...By and large, I have come to see that if we complain about life, it is because we are thinking only of ourselves.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Sometimes life knocks you on your ass... get up, get up, get up!!! Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.

Author: Pat Conroy,  The Lords of Discipline
Quote: Happiness is an accident of nature, a beautiful and flawless aberration.

Author: Ann Brashares,  The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants
Quote: Maybe the truth is, there's a little bit of loser in all of us. Being happy isn't having everything in your life be perfect. Maybe it's about stringing together all the little things.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: There is some kind of a sweet innocence in being human- in not having to be just happy or just sad- in the nature of being able to be both broken and whole, at the same time.

Author: William Shakespeare,  The Merchant of Venice
Quote: With mirth and laughter let old wrinkles come.

Author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice
Quote: I am the happiest creature in the world. Perhaps other people have said so before, but not one with such justice. I am happier even than Jane; she only smiles, I laugh.

Author: Aldous Huxley,  Brave New World
Quote: Actual happiness always looks pretty squalid in comparison with the overcompensations for misery. And, of course, stability isn't nearly so spectacular as instability. And being contented has none of the glamour of a good fight against misfortune, none of the picturesqueness of a struggle with temptation, or a fatal overthrow by passion or doubt. Happiness is never grand.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: Those who are not looking for happiness are the most likely to find it, because those who are searching forget that the surest way to be happy is to seek happiness for others.

Author: Carrie Jones,  Need
Quote: The secret of happiness is freedom, the secret of freedom is courage.

Author: Rainbow Rowell,  Fangirl
Quote: Happily ever after, or even just together ever after, is not cheesy,” Wren said. “It’s the noblest, like, the most courageous thing two people can shoot for.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Ocean at the End of the Lane
Quote: I do not miss childhood, but I miss the way I took pleasure in small things, even as greater things crumbled. I could not control the world I was in, could not walk away from things or people or moments that hurt, but I took joy in the things that made me happy.

Author: Henrik Ibsen,  Ghosts
Quote: It is the very mark of the spirit of rebellion to crave for happiness in this life

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: There is nothing more rare, nor more beautiful, than a woman being unapologetically herself; comfortable in her perfect imperfection. To me, that is the true essence of beauty.

Author: Stephen Richards
Quote: When you do what you fear most, then you can do anything.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.

Author: Seneca
Quote: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future, not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient, for he that is so wants nothing. The greatest blessings of mankind are within us and within our reach. A wise man is content with his lot, whatever it may be, without wishing for what he has not.

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Family Happiness
Quote: A quiet secluded life in the country, with the possibility of being useful to people to whom it is easy to do good, and who are not accustomed to have it done to them; then work which one hopes may be of some use; then rest, nature, books, music, love for one's neighbor — such is my idea of happiness.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: I'm choosing happiness over suffering, I know I am. I'm making space for the unknown future to fill up my life with yet-to-come surprises.

Author: Anne Frank,  The Diary of a Young Girl
Quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: There are two ways to get enough. One is to continue to accumulate more and more. The other is to desire less.

Author: Drew Barrymore
Quote: I think happiness is what makes you pretty. Period. Happy people are beautiful. They become like a mirror and they reflect that happiness.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Nineteen Minutes
Quote: A mathematical formula for happiness:Reality divided by Expectations.There were two ways to be happy:improve your reality or lower your expectations.

Author: Tony DeLiso,  Legacy: The Power Within
Quote: Keep your best wishes, close to your heart and watch what happens

Author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Quote: This planet has - or rather had - a problem, which was this: most of the people living on it were unhappy for pretty much of the time. Many solutions were suggested for this problem, but most of these were largely concerned with the movement of small green pieces of paper, which was odd because on the whole it wasn't the small green pieces of paper that were unhappy.

Author: Max Ehrmann,  Desiderata: A Poem for a Way of Life
Quote: With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams,it is still a beautiful world.Be cheerful.Strive to be happy.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Witch Of Portobello
Quote: After all, what is happiness? Love, they tell me. But love doesn't bring and never has brought happiness. On the contrary, it's a constant state of anxiety, a battlefield; it's sleepless nights, asking ourselves all the time if we're doing the right thing. Real love is composed of ecstasy and agony.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: I have no faith in human perfectibility. I think that human exertion will have no appreciable effect upon humanity. Man is now only more active - not more happy - nor more wise, than he was 6000 years ago.

Author: Groucho Marx,  The Essential Groucho: Writings For By And About Groucho Marx
Quote: I, not events, have the power to make me happy or unhappy today. I can choose which it shall be. Yesterday is dead, tomorrow hasn't arrived yet. I have just one day, today, and I'm going to be happy in it.

Author: Osho,  Everyday Osho: 365 Daily Meditations for the Here and Now
Quote: Sadness gives depth. Happiness gives height. Sadness gives roots. Happiness gives branches. Happiness is like a tree going into the sky, and sadness is like the roots going down into the womb of the earth. Both are needed, and the higher a tree goes, the deeper it goes, simultaneously. The bigger the tree, the bigger will be its roots. In fact, it is always in proportion. That's its balance.

Author: Marianne Williamson
Quote: Children are happy because they don't have a file in their minds called "All the Things That Could Go Wrong.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: I will not try to convince you to love me, to respect me, to commit to me. I deserve better than that; I AM BETTER THAN THAT...Goodbye.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
Quote: Happiness is not a goal...it's a by-product of a life well lived.

Author: Martha Washington
Quote: The greater part of our happiness or misery depends upon our dispositions, and not upon our circumstances.

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: Don’t sacrifice yourself too much, because if you sacrifice too much there’s nothing else you can give and nobody will care for you.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: She is free in her wildness, she is a wanderess, a drop of free water. She knows nothing of borders and cares nothing for rules or customs. 'Time' for her isn’t something to fight against. Her life flows clean, with passion, like fresh water.

Author: Bill Watterson,  Weirdos From Another Planet: Calvin & Hobbes Series: Book Six: A Calvin and Hobbes Collection
Quote: That's the difference between me and the rest of the world! Happiness isn't good enough for me! I demand euphoria!

Author: George R.R. Martin,  A Game of Thrones
Quote: Laughter is poison to fear.

Author: Louisa May Alcott
Quote: The power of finding beauty in the humblest things makes home happy and life lovely.

Author: Louisa May Alcott
Quote: The power of finding beauty in the humblest things makes home happy and life lovely.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: I am a happy camper so I guess I’m doing something right. Happiness is like a butterfly; the more you chase it, the more it will elude you, but if you turn your attention to other things, it will come and sit softly on your shoulder.

Author: Audrey Hepburn
Quote: I heard a definition once: Happiness is health and a short memory! I wish I'd invented it, because it is very true.

Author: Daphne du Maurier,  Rebecca
Quote: Happiness is not a possession to be prized, it is a quality of thought, a state of mind.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Everything Is Illuminated
Quote: I don't think that there are any limits to how excellent we could make life seem.

Author: Sri Chinmoy
Quote: I am very happyBecause I have conquered myselfAnd not the world.I am very happyBecause I have loved the worldAnd not myself.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Norwegian Wood
Quote: I have a million things to talk to you about. All I want in this world is you. I want to see you and talk. I want the two of us to begin everything from the beginning.

Author: J.D. Salinger,  Franny and Zooey
Quote: And I can't be running back and fourth forever between grief and high delight.

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: We don’t even ask happiness, just a little less pain.

Author: John Keats,  Endymion: A Poetic Romance
Quote: A thing of beauty is a joy forever.

Author: Andy Rooney
Quote: Everyone wants to live on top of the mountain, but all the happiness and growth occurs while you're climbing it.

Author: William James
Quote: Action may not always bring happiness, but there is no happiness without action.

Author: John Barrowman
Quote: I've always thought people would find a lot more pleasure in their routines if they burst into song at significant moments.

Author: Graham Greene,  The End of the Affair
Quote: The sense of unhappiness is so much easier to convey than that of happiness. In misery we seem aware of our own existence, even though it may be in the form of a monstrous egotism: this pain of mine is individual, this nerve that winces belongs to me and to no other. But happiness annihilates us: we lose our identity.

Author: Anaïs Nin,  Henry & June
Quote: What can I do with my happiness? How can I keep it, conceal it, bury it where I may never lose it? I want to kneel as it falls over me like rain, gather it up with lace and silk, and press it over myself again.

Author: Hanh Nhat Thich,  The Heart of the Buddha's Teaching: Transforming Suffering into Peace, Joy, and Liberation
Quote: Letting go gives us freedom, and freedom is the only condition for happiness. If, in our heart, we still cling to anything - anger, anxiety, or possessions - we cannot be free.

Author: J.D. Salinger,  Raise High the Roof Beam, Carpenters & Seymour: An Introduction
Quote: I'm a kind of paranoiac in reverse. I suspect people of plotting to make me happy.

Author: Edith Wharton
Quote: If only we'd stop trying to be happy, we could have a pretty good time.

Author: Matthew Quick,  The Silver Linings Playbook
Quote: Life is not a PG feel-good movie. Real life often ends badly. Literature tries to document this reality, while showing us it is still possible for us to endure nobly.

Author: Sarah Addison Allen,  The Peach Keeper
Quote: Happiness is a risk. If you’re not a little scared, then you’re not doing it right.

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer
Quote: Happiness consists in frequent repetition of pleasure

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: I find the best way to love someone is not to change them, but instead, help them reveal the greatest version of themselves.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: The pain I feel now is the happiness I had before. That's the deal.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.

Author: Susan Polis Schutz
Quote: This life is yours. Take the power to choose what you want to do and do it well. Take the power to love what you want in life and love it honestly. Take the power to walk in the forest and be a part of nature. Take the power to control your own life. No one else can do it for you. Take the power to make your life happy.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Zahir
Quote: No one should ever ask themselves that: why am I unhappy? The question carries within it the virus that will destroy everything. If we ask that question, it means we want to find out what makes us happy. If what makes us happy is different from what we have now, then we must either change once and for all or stay as we are, feeling even more unhappy.

Author: Daisaku Ikeda
Quote: Even if things don't unfold the way you expected, don't be disheartened or give up. One who continues to advance will win in the end.

Author: Daniel Keyes,  Flowers for Algernon
Quote: I don’t know what’s worse: to not know what you are and be happy, or to become what you’ve always wanted to be, and feel alone.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV,  The Art of Happiness
Quote: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Much Ado About Nothing
Quote: I had rather hear my dog bark at a crow, than a man swear he loves me.

Author: Anne Frank
Quote: We all live with the objective of being happy; our lives are all different and yet the same.

Author: Jennifer Niven,  All the Bright Places
Quote: The problem with people is they forget that most of the time it's the small things that count.

Author: Ayn Rand,  Anthem
Quote: My happiness is not the means to any end. It is the end. It is its own goal. It is its own purpose.

Author: George Gordon Byron,  Don Juan
Quote: All who joy would winMust share it -- Happiness was born a twin.

Author: Laini Taylor,  Daughter of Smoke & Bone
Quote: Happiness. It was the place where passion, with all its dazzle and drumbeat, met something softer: homecoming and safety and pure sunbeam comfort. It was all those things, intertwined with the heat and the thrill, and it was as bright within her as a swallowed star.

Author: Gordon B. Hinckley
Quote: Be believing, be happy, don't get discouraged. Things will work out.

Author: Fulton J. Sheen,  Seven Words of Jesus and Mary: Lessons from Cana and Calvary
Quote: It takes three to make love, not two: you, your spouse, and God. Without God people only succeed in bringing out the worst in one another. Lovers who have nothing else to do but love each other soon find there is nothing else. Without a central loyalty life is unfinished.

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre
Quote: There is no happiness like that of being loved by your fellow creatures, and feeling that your presence is an addition to their comfort.

Author: Melissa de la Cruz,  The Van Alen Legacy
Quote: You cannot be with someone just because you don’t want to hurt him. You have your own happiness to think about.

Author: Alex Flinn,  Beastly
Quote: those who do not know how to see the precious things in life will never be happy.

Author: Stephen Richards
Quote: To dream by night is to escape your life. To dream by day is to make it happen.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: You must give everything to make your life as beautiful as the dreams that dance in your imagination.

Author: Hanh Nhat Thich,  The Art of Power
Quote: Many people think excitement is happiness.... But when you are excited you are not peaceful. True happiness is based on peace.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

Author: Conan O'Brien
Quote: All I ask is one thing, and I’m asking this particularly of young people: please don’t be cynical. I hate cynicism, for the record, it’s my least favorite quality and it doesn’t lead anywhere. Nobody in life gets exactly what they thought they were going to get. But if you work really hard and you’re kind, amazing things will happen.

Author: Joanne Harris,  Chocolat
Quote: Happiness. Simple as a glass of chocolate or tortuous as the heart. Bitter. Sweet. Alive.

Author: Audrey Hepburn
Quote: Happy girls are the prettiest

Author: Shannon Hale,  Princess Academy
Quote: There you go...let it all slide out. Unhappiness can't stick in a person's soul when it's slick with tears.

Author: Jeremy Aldana
Quote: I am intrigued by the smile upon your face, and the sadness within your eyes

Author: Lucille Ball
Quote: It's a helluva start, being able to recognize what makes you happy.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself in your way of thinking.

Author: Alexander McCall Smith,  Morality for Beautiful Girls
Quote: It is sometimes easier to be happy if you don't know everything.

Author: Mary Tyler Moore
Quote: You can't be brave if you've only had wonderful things happen to you.

Author: Dale Carnegie
Quote: Success is getting what you want..Happiness is wanting what you get.

Author: Gregory David Roberts,  Shantaram
Quote: Sometimes you break your heart in the right way, if you know what I mean.

Author: Edmund Burke
Quote: Woman is not made to be the admiration of all, but the happiness of one.

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
Quote: It does not matter how long you are spending on the earth, how much money you have gathered or how much attention you have received. It is the amount of positive vibration you have radiated in life that matters,

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Anna Karenina
Quote: They've got no idea what happiness is, they don't know that without this love there is no happiness or unhappiness for us--there is no life.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting some on yourself.

Author: Milan Kundera,  The Unbearable Lightness of Being
Quote: And therein lies the whole of man's plight. Human time does not turn in a circle; it runs ahead in a straight line. That is why man cannot be happy: happiness is the longing for repetition.

Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  A Stroke of Midnight
Quote: Love is too precious to be ashamed of.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Plant seeds of happiness, hope, success, and love; it will all come back to you in abundance. This is the law of nature.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: My past has not defined me, destroyed me, deterred me, or defeated me; it has only strengthened me.

Author: Maggie Stiefvater,  Shiver
Quote: right in this moment, I can´t even remember what unhappy feels like.

Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Ones Who Walk Away from Omelas
Quote: The trouble is that we have a bad habit, encouraged by pedants and sophisticates, of considering happiness as something rather stupid. Only pain is intellectual, only evil interesting. This is the treason of the artist; a refusal to admit the banality of evil and the terrible boredom of pain.

Author: J.D. Salinger,  Franny and Zooey
Quote: I don't know what good it is to know so much and be smart as whips and all if it doesn't make you happy.

Author: Ally Carter,  Heist Society
Quote: And I didn't choose it, Kat. I chose you.

Author: Bob Marley
Quote: Just because you are happy it does not mean that the day is perfect but that you have looked beyond its imperfections

Author: Susan Polis Schutz
Quote: Let us dance in the sun, wearing wild flowers in our hair...

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close
Quote: Feathers filled the small room. Our laughter kept the feathers in the air. I thought about birds. Could they fly is there wasn't someone, somewhere, laughing?

Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Prince
Quote: She had never imagined she had the power to make someone else so happy. And not a magical power, either--a purely human one.

Author: Dave Ramsey,  The Total Money Makeover: A Proven Plan for Financial Fitness
Quote: We buy things we don't need with money we don't have to impress people we don't like.

Author: Lois Lowry,  Anastasia Krupnik
Quote: Memory is the happiness of being alone.

Author: Mark Twain,  Notebook
Quote: Obscurity and a competence—that is the life that is best worth living.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV
Quote: Only the development of compassion and understanding for others can bring us the tranquility and happiness we all seek.

Author: John Lubbock,  The Pleasures of Life
Quote: Art is unquestionably one of the purest and highest elements in human happiness. It trains the mind through the eye, and the eye through the mind. As the sun colors flowers, so does art color life.

Author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering: You can be successful
Quote: The only time you fail is when you fall down and stay down.

Author: Orson Scott Card,  Ender's Game
Quote: Humanity does not ask us to be happy. It merely asks us to be brilliant on its behalf.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: People wait around too long for love. I'm happy with all of my lusts!

Author: Allen Ginsberg
Quote: We're all golden sunflowers inside.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Quote: You have to participate relentlessly in the manifestation of your own blessings.

Author: Thomas Hardy,  The Mayor of Casterbridge
Quote: Happiness was but the occasional episode in a general drama of pain.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Quote: People tend to think that happiness is a stroke of luck, something that will descend like fine weather if you're fortunate. But happiness is the result of personal effort. You fight for it, strive for it, insist upon it, and sometimes even travel around the world looking for it. You have to participate relentlessly.

Author: Carlos Castaneda
Quote: The trick is in what one emphasizes. We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power or our will.

Author: Françoise Sagan
Quote: Money may not buy happiness, but I'd rather cry in a Jaguar than on a bus.

Author: Lauren Oliver,  Requiem
Quote: But maybe happiness isn't in the choosing. Maybe it's in the fiction, in the pretending: that wherever we have ended up is where we intended to be all along.

Author: Simone Elkeles,  How to Ruin Your Boyfriend's Reputation
Quote: Expectations make people miserable, so whatever yours are, lower them. You'll definitely be happier.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Nineteen Minutes
Quote: There are two ways to be happy: improve your reality, or lower your expectations.

Author: حافظ
Quote: Ever since happiness heard your name, it has been running through the streets trying to find you.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  Tender is the Night
Quote: Later she remembered all the hours of the afternoon as happy -- one of those uneventful times that seem at the moment only a link between past and future pleasure, but turn out to have been the pleasure itself.

Author: Gillian Flynn,  Gone Girl
Quote: I don't understand the point of being together if you're not the happiest.

Author: Aristotle,  The Nicomachean Ethics
Quote: One swallow does not make a summer,neither does one fine day; similarly one day or brief time of happiness does not make a person entirely happy.

Author: Ben Carson
Quote: Happiness doesn't result from what we get, but from what we give.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath
Quote: Is anyone anywhere happy?

Author: Aldous Huxley
Quote: Happiness is not achieved by the conscious pursuit of happiness; it is generally the by-product of other activities.

Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass
Quote: Dance. Smile. Giggle. Marvel. TRUST. HOPE. LOVE. WISH. BELIEVE. Most of all, enjoy every moment of the journey, and appreciate where you are at this moment instead of always focusing on how far you have to go.

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  War and Peace
Quote: Pierre was right when he said that one must believe in the possibility of happiness in order to be happy, and I now believe in it. Let the dead bury the dead, but while I'm alive, I must live and be happy.

Author: Katerina Stoykova Klemer
Quote: There is no beauty in sadness. No honor in suffering. No growth in fear. No relief in hate. It’s just a waste of perfectly good happiness.

Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  White Nights
Quote: My God, a moment of bliss. Why, isn't that enough for a whole lifetime?

Author: J.M. Barrie
Quote: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes, but in liking what one does.

Author: Dorothy Parker
Quote: If you have any young friends who aspire to become writers, the second greatest favor you can do them is to present them with copies of The Elements of Style. The first greatest, of course, is to shoot them now, while they’re happy.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: As long as I am breathing, in my eyes, I am just beginning.

Author: Wil Zeus,  Sun Beyond the Clouds
Quote: Always forgive, but never forget, else you will be a prisoner of your own hatred, and doomed to repeat your mistakes forever.

Author: Daisaku Ikeda
Quote: it is impossible to build one's own happiness on the unhappiness of others. This perspective is at the heart of Buddhist teachings.

Author: Ellen Hopkins
Quote: Happiness, you see, its just an illusion of Fate, a heavenly sleight of hand designed to make you believe in fairy tales. But there's no happily ever after. You'll only find happy endings in books. Some books.

Author: Stephen Richards
Quote: The true measure of success is how many times you can bounce back from failure.

Author: Julian Barnes,  Flaubert's Parrot
Quote: To be stupid, and selfish, and to have good health are the three requirements for happiness - though if stupidity is lacking, the others are useless.

Author: Joseph Addison
Quote: What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. These are but trifles, to be sure; but scattered along life's pathway, the good they do is inconceivable.

Author: Elizabeth Berg,  The Art of Mending
Quote: There are random moments - tossing a salad, coming up the driveway to the house, ironing the seams flat on a quilt square, standing at the kitchen window and looking out at the delphiniums, hearing a burst of laughter from one of my children's rooms - when I feel a wavelike rush of joy. This is my true religion: arbitrary moments of of nearly painful happiness for a life I feel privileged to lead.

Author: Christopher McCandless
Quote: Happiness only real when shared.

Author: Joseph Addison
Quote: What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. These are but trifles, to be sure; but scattered along life's pathway, the good they do is inconceivable.

Author: Doris Mortman
Quote: Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have.

Author: Lev Grossman,  The Magicians
Quote: [F]or just one second, look at your life and see how perfect it is. Stop looking for the next secret door that is going to lead you to your real life. Stop waiting. This is it: there's nothing else. It's here, and you'd better decide to enjoy it or you're going to be miserable wherever you go, for the rest of your life, forever.

Author: Hanh Nhat Thich,  Peace Is Every Step: The Path of Mindfulness in Everyday Life
Quote: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it. (21)

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: Seize the moments of happiness, love and be loved! That is the only reality in the world, all else is folly. It is the one thing we are interested in here.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  Complete Stories and Poems of Edgar Allen Poe
Quote: It is a happiness to wonder; -- it is a happiness to dream.

Author: Sylvain Reynard,  Gabriel's Inferno
Quote: You, of all people, deserve a happy ending. Despite everything that happened to you, you aren't bitter. You aren't cold. You've just retreated a little and been shy, and that's okay. If I were a fairy godmother, I would give you your heart's desire in an istant. And I would wipe away your tears and tell you not to cry.-Rachel to Julia

Author: Stephen Richards
Quote: When you connect to the silence within you, that is when you can make sense of the disturbance going on around you.

Author: Nick Hornby,  How to Be Good
Quote: You don't ask people with knives in their stomachs what would make them happy; happiness is no longer the point. It's all about survival; it's all about whether you pull the knife out and bleed to death or keep it in...

Author: Carroll Bryant
Quote: Growing old is mandatory. Growing up is optional.

Author: Brian L. Weiss
Quote: Happiness comes from within. It is not dependent on external things or on other people. You become vulnerable and can be easily hurt when your feelings of security and happiness depend on the behavior and actions of other people. Never give your power to anyone else.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Nineteen Minutes
Quote: There were two ways to be happy: improve your reality, or lower your expectations

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: Can a person steal happiness? Or is just another internal, infernal human trick?

Author: Daisaku Ikeda
Quote: Life is painful. It has thorns, like the stem of a rose. Culture and art are the roses that bloom on the stem. The flower is yourself, your humanity. Art is the liberation of the humanity inside yourself.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Happiness does not come from without, it comes from within

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Safe Haven
Quote: ...nothing wonderful lasted forever. Joy was as fleeting as a shooting star that crossed the evening sky, ready to blink out at any moment.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Some people are so much sunshine to the square inch.

Author: Jane Austen,  Emma
Quote: You must be the best judge of your own happiness.

Author: George Sand
Quote: One is happy as a result of one's own efforts once one knows the necessary ingredients of happiness: simple tastes, a certain degree of courage, self denial to a point, love of work, and above all, a clear conscience.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The love of my life has made me the happiest man ever. This ever-smiling man/mannequin is so happy because he’s got no brain, and in this way is identical to anyone who still rah-rahs for either a Republican or a Democrat.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I consider myself a stained-glass window. And this is how I live my life. Closing no doors and covering no windows; I am the multi-colored glass with light filtering through me, in many different shades. Allowing light to shed and fall into many many hues. My job is not to direct anything, but only to filter into many colors. My answer is destiny and my guide is joy. And there you have me.

Author: Dale Carnegie,  How to Win Friends and Influence People
Quote: Everybody in the world is seeking happiness—and there is one sure way to find it. That is by controlling your thoughts. Happiness doesn't depend on outward conditions. It depends on inner conditions.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Destiny is real. And she's not mild-mannered. She will come around and hit you in the face and knock you over and before you know what hit you, you're naked- stripped of everything you thought you knew and everything you thought you didn't know- and there you are! A bloody nose, bruises all over you, and naked. And it's the most beautiful thing.

Author: James Oppenheim
Quote: The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance. The wise grows it under his feet.

Author: Jacqueline Kelly,  The Evolution of Calpurnia Tate
Quote: Ahhh. Bed, book, kitten, sandwich. All one needed in life, really.

Author: Booker T. Washington,  Up from Slavery
Quote: Those who are happiest are those who do the most for others.

Author: David Archuleta,  Chords of Strength: A Memoir of Soul, Song and the Power of Perseverance
Quote: I like to believe that you don't need to reach a certain goal to be happy. I prefer to think that happiness is always there, and that when things don't go the way we might like them to, it's a sign from above that something even better is right around the corner.

Author: Jane Austen,  Mansfield Park
Quote: A large income is the best recipe for happiness I ever heard of.

Author: Anthony de Mello,  Awareness
Quote: Perfect love casts out fear. Where there is love there are no demands, no expectations, no dependency. I do not demand that you make me happy; my happiness does not lie in you. If you were to leave me, I will not feel sorry for myself; I enjoy your company immensely, but I do not cling.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  All the Sad Young Men
Quote: So he tasted the deep pain that is reserved only for the strong, just as he had tasted for a little while the deep happiness.

Author: Ann Brashares,  Sisterhood Everlasting
Quote: Maybe you think you’ll be entitled to more happiness later by forgoing all of it now, but it doesn’t work that way. Happiness takes as much practice as unhappiness does. It’s by living that you live more. By waiting you wait more. Every waiting day makes your life a little less. Every lonely day makes you a little smaller. Every day you put off your life makes you less capable of living it.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: There is a kind of happiness and wonder that makes you serious. It is too good to waste on jokes.

Author: Marcel Pagnol
Quote: The reason people find it so hard to be happy is that they always see the past better than it was, the present worse than it is, and the future less resolved than it will be.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: Age does not make us childish, as some say; it finds us true children.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Be happy with who you are and what you do, and you can do anything you want.

Author: Roman Payne,  The Wanderess
Quote: I was an adventurer, but she was not an adventuress. She was a 'wanderess.' Thus, she didn’t care about money, only experiences - whether they came from wealth or from poverty, it was all the same to her.

Author: Cornelia Funke,  Inkheart
Quote: Dustfinger still clearly remembered the feeling of being in love for the first time. How vulnerable his heart had suddenly been! Such a trembling, quivering thing, happy and miserably unhappy at once.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Kafka on the Shore
Quote: That’s how stories happen — with a turning point, an unexpected twist. There’s only one kind of happiness, but misfortune comes in all shapes and sizes. It’s like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a story.

Author: H.L. Mencken,  A Mencken Chrestomathy
Quote: Puritanism: The haunting fear that someone, somewhere, may be happy.

Author: محمد المخزنجي,  البستان
Quote: إن السعادة هي أن أشرب كوب شاي.. مع صديق.. في لحظة رضا.

Author: Alexandre Dumas
Quote: Happiness is like those palaces in fairytales whose gates are guarded by dragons: We must fight in order to conquer it.

Author: Marilyn Monroe,  My Story
Quote: For those who are poor in happiness, each time is a first time; happiness never becomes a habit.

Author: Tana French,  In the Woods
Quote: I am not good at noticing when I'm happy, except in retrospect.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: If you are not the hero of your own story, then you're missing the whole point of your humanity.

Author: L. Frank Baum,  The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
Quote: I shall take the heart. For brains do not make one happy, and happiness is the best thing in the world.

Author: Junot Díaz,  The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao
Quote: That’s life for you. All the happiness you gather to yourself, it will sweep away like it’s nothing. If you ask me I don’t think there are any such things as curses. I think there is only life. That’s enough.

Author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo
Quote: Those born to wealth, and who have the means of gratifying every wish, know not what is the real happiness of life, just as those who have been tossed on the stormy waters of the ocean on a few frail planks can alone realize the blessings of fair weather.

Author: Michael J. Fox
Quote: My happiness grows in direct proportion to my acceptance, and in inverse proportion to my expectations.

Author: Joseph Smith Jr.
Quote: Happiness is the object and design of our existence; and will be the end thereof, if we pursue the path that leads to it; and this path is virtue, uprightness, faithfulness, holiness, and keeping all the commandments of God.

Author: Charles Dickens,  Nicholas Nickleby
Quote: Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.

Author: Dale Carnegie
Quote: It isn't what you have, or who you are, or where you are, or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about.

Author: Jennifer E. Smith,  This Is What Happy Looks Like
Quote: Exactly. How can you know it makes you happy if you’ve never experienced it?”“There are different kinds of happy,” she said. “Some kinds don’t need any proof.

Author: Christopher Paolini
Quote: If you wish to be happy,Eragon, Think not of what is to come nor of that which you have no control over but rather of the now and that which you are able to change"~Oromis to eragon ,Brisingr~618

Author: Tony DeLiso,  Legacy: The Power Within
Quote: Happiness is part of who we are. Joy is the feeling

Author: Dan Wells,  Partials
Quote: Happiness is the most natural thing in the world when you have it, and the slowest, strangest, most impossible thing when you don't. It's like learning a foreign language: You can think about the words all you want, but you'll never be able to speak it until you suck up your courage and say them out loud.

Author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
Quote: In the end, the number of prayers we say may contribute to our happiness, but the number of prayers we answer may be of even greater importance.

Author: Nina LaCour,  Hold Still
Quote: dear today, i spend all of you pretending i'm okay when i'm not, pretending i'm happy when i'm not, pretending about everything to everyone.

Author: Willa Cather,  My Ántonia
Quote: I was something that lay under the sun and felt it, like the pumpkins, and I did not want to be anything more. I was entirely happy. Perhaps we feel like that when we die and become a part of something entire, whether it is sun and air, or goodness and knowledge. At any rate, that is happiness; to be dissolved into something complete and great. When it comes to one, it comes as naturally as sleep.

Author: Aeschylus
Quote: Happiness is a choice that requires effort at times.

Author: E.L. Konigsburg,  From the Mixed-Up Files of Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler
Quote: Happiness is excitement that has found a settling down place, but there is always a little corner that keeps flapping around.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: When you are joyful, when you say yes to life and have fun and project positivity all around you, you become a sun in the center of every constellation, and people want to be near you.

Author: Gustave Flaubert
Quote: To be stupid, selfish, and have good health are three requirements for happiness, though if stupidity is lacking, all is lost.

Author: Jean-Yves Leloup,  Compassion and Meditation: The Spiritual Dynamic between Buddhism and Christianity
Quote: Sometimes we must undergo hardships, breakups, and narcissistic wounds, which shatter the flattering image that we had of ourselves, in order to discover two truths: that we are not who we thought we were; and that the loss of a cherished pleasure is not necessarily the loss of true happiness and well-being. (109)

Author: Bobbe Sommer
Quote: Having a low opinion of yourself is not 'modesty.' It's self-destruction. Holding your uniqueness in high regard is not 'egotism.' It's a necessary precondition to happiness and success.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Happiness is not the absence of problems; it's the ability to deal with them.

Author: Marlene Dietrich,  Marlene Dietrich's ABC
Quote: I do not think we have a "right"to happiness. If happiness happens, say thanks.

Author: Marie Rutkoski,  The Winner's Curse
Quote: Happiness depends on being free, and freedom depends on being courageous.

Author: Hugh Downs
Quote: A happy person is not a person in a certain set of circumstances, but rather a person with a certain set of attitudes.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath
Quote: I may never be happy, but tonight I am content.

Author: Leo Babauta
Quote: The way I define happiness is being the creator of your experience, choosing to take pleasure in what you have, right now, regardless of the circumstances, while being the best you that you can be.

Author: William Blake
Quote: He whose face gives no light, shall never become a star.

Author: Martha Washington
Quote: I am still determined to be cheerful and happy, in whatever situation I may be; for I have also learned from experience that the greater part of our happiness or misery depends upon our dispositions, and not upon our circumstances. a

Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Stop trying to 'fix' yourself; you're NOT broken! You are perfectly imperfect and powerful beyond measure.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: Happiness and the absurd are two sons of the same earth. They are inseparable.

Author: Kurt Cobain
Quote: You can't buy happiness

Author: Melody Carstairs
Quote: If you've got nothing to dance about, find a reason to sing.

Author: Bertrand Russell,  The Impact of Science on Society
Quote: Really high-minded people are indifferent to happiness, especially other people's.

Author: Bertrand Russell
Quote: The secret of happiness is to face the fact that the world is horrible, horrible, horrible.

Author: Honoré de Balzac,  Père Goriot
Quote: Some day you will find out that there is far more happiness in another's happiness than in your own.

Author: Napoléon Bonaparte,  In the Words of Napoleon: A Collection of Quotations of Napoleon Bonaparte
Quote: A woman laughing is a woman conquered.

Author: Gretchen Rubin,  The Happiness Project: Or Why I Spent a Year Trying to Sing in the Morning, Clean My Closets, Fight Right, Read Aristotle, and Generally Have More Fun
Quote: Laughter is more than just a pleasurable activity...When people laugh together, they tend to talk and touch more and to make eye contact more frequently.

Author: Wayne W. Dyer
Quote: You have everything you need for complete peace and total happiness right now.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close
Quote: ...is ignorance bliss, I don't know, but it's so painful to think, and tell me, what did thinking ever do for me, to what great place did thinking ever bring me? I think and think and think, I've thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.

Author: Alessandra Torre
Quote: The true measure of a man is how he treats you when others are not looking.

Author: Matt Smith
Quote: I think, that if the world were a bit more like ComicCon, it would be a better place.

Author: George Washington
Quote: Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.

Author: Robert Anthony
Quote: Most people would rather be certain they're miserable, than risk being happy.

Author: Daisaku Ikeda
Quote: Leave behind the passive dreaming of a rose-tinted future. The energy of happiness exists in living today with roots sunk firmly in reality's soil.

Author: Epicurus,  A Guide To Happiness
Quote: Of all the means to insure happiness throughout the whole life, by far the most important is the acquisition of friends.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: The greatest love stories are not those in which love is only spoken, but those in which it is acted upon.

Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Quote: Happiness is not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Lucky One
Quote: She had been proud of his decision to serve his country, her heart bursting with love and admiration the first time she saw him outfitted in his dress blues.

Author: Gregory David Roberts,  Shantaram
Quote: Happiness is a myth. It was invented to make us buy new things.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Norwegian Wood
Quote: With my eyes closed, I would touch a familiar book and draw its fragrance deep inside me. This was enough to make me happy.

Author: Albert Schweitzer
Quote: I don't know what your destiny will be, but one thing I know: the only ones among you who will be really happy are those who have sought and found how to serve.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Lucky One
Quote: It was their secret, a secret meant for just the two of them, and she'd never been able to imagine how it would sound coming from someone else. But, somehow, Logan made it sound just right.

Author: Lemony Snicket,  The End
Quote: It is almost as if happiness is an acquired taste, like coconut cordial or ceviche, to which you can eventually become accustomed, but despair is something surprising each time you encounter it.

Author: Stephen Richards
Quote: Our way of thinking creates good or bad outcomes.

Author: Sarah Addison Allen
Quote: I needed to stop being what everyone thought I was.

Author: Orson Scott Card,  Ender's Game
Quote: We have to go. I'm almost happy here.

Author: David Benioff,  When the Nines Roll Over and Other Stories
Quote: There are a few moments in your life when you are truly and completely happy, and you remember to give thanks. Even as it happens you are nostalgic for the moment, you are tucking it away in your scrapbook.

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: Beauty is the purest feeling of the soul. Beauty arises when soul is satisfied.

Author: Orson Scott Card,  Pastwatch: The Redemption of Christopher Columbus
Quote: Happiness is not a life without pain, but rather a life in which the pain is traded for a worthy price.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Happiness is a state of activity.

Author: J.M. Coetzee
Quote: The secret of happiness is not doing what we like but in liking what we do.

Author: Pearl S. Buck
Quote: To serve is beautiful, but only if it is done with joy and a whole heart and a free mind.

Author: Charles M. Schulz
Quote: That's the secret to life... replace one worry with another....

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: If you fuel your journey on the opinions of others, you are going to run out of gas.

Author: Irving Berlin
Quote: Got no checkbooks, got no banks. Still I'd like to express my thanks - I've got the sun in the mornin' and the moon at night.

Author: Mark Strand,  Selected Poems
Quote: Ink runs from the corners of my mouth.There is no happiness like mine.I have been eating poetry.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Love yourself. Forgive yourself. Be true to yourself. How you treat yourself sets the standard for how others will treat you.

Author: Julian Gough,  Juno & Juliet
Quote: Hurt is a part of life. To be honest, I think hurt is a part of happiness, that our definition of happiness has gotten very narrow lately, very nervous, a little afraid of this brawling, fabulous, unpredictable world.

Author: Jim Morrison,  An American Prayer
Quote: I'll never wake up in a good mood again.I'm tired of these stinky boots

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of the Island
Quote: Anne was always glad in the happiness of her friends; but it is sometimes a little lonely to be surrounded everywhere by happiness that is not your own.

Author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti
Quote: Recipe For Happiness Khaborovsk Or Anyplace'One grand boulevard with treeswith one grand cafe in sunwith strong black coffee in very small cups.One not necessarily very beautifulman or woman who loves you.One fine day.

Author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo
Quote: I don’t think man was meant to attain happiness so easily. Happiness is like those palaces in fairy tales whose gates are guarded by dragons: we must fight in order to conquer it.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: The lesson will always repeat itself, unless you see yourself as the problem--not others.

Author: Dan Howell
Quote: My only regrets are the moments when i doubted myself and took the safe route. Life is too short to waste time being unhappy.

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.

Author: Robyn Schneider,  The Beginning of Everything
Quote: If everything really does get better, the way everyone claims, then happiness should be graphable. But that's crap, because better isn't quantifiable.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Do not sabotage your new relationship with your last relationship’s poison.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: You have a unique gift to offer this world. Be true to yourself, be kind to yourself, read and learn about everything that interests you and keep away from people who bring you down. When you treat yourself kindly and respect the uniqueness of those around you, you will be giving this world an amazing gift... YOU!

Author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox,  Poems of Passion
Quote: Laugh, and the world laughs with you;Weep, and you weep alone;For the sad old earth must borrow its mirth,But has trouble enough of its own.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.

Author: Jean Anthelme Brillat-Savarin,  The Physiology of Taste: Or, Meditations on Transcendental Gastronomy
Quote: The discovery of a new dish does more for the happiness of the human race than the discovery of a star.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: Love doesn't make the world go 'round; love is what makes the ride worthwhile.

Author: Carl Sandburg,  Honey and Salt
Quote: Come clean with a child heartLaugh as peaches in the summer windLet rain on a house roof be a songLet the writing on your facebe a smell of apple orchards on late June.

Author: Albert Camus,  The Fall
Quote: Your success and happiness are forgiven you only if you generously consent to share them. But to be happy it is essential not to be too concerned with others. Consequently, there is no escape. Happy and judged, or absolved and wretched.

Author: Michael Pollan,  The Omnivore's Dilemma: A Natural History of Four Meals
Quote: The single greatest lesson the garden teaches is that our relationship to the planet need not be zero-sum, and that as long as the sun still shines and people still can plan and plant, think and do, we can, if we bother to try, find ways to provide for ourselves without diminishing the world.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Yesterday I was sad, today I am happy! Yesterday I had a problem, today I still have the same problem! But today I changed the way I look at it!

Author: Dale Carnegie
Quote: Remember, happiness doesn't depend upon who you are or what you have, it depends solely upon what you think.

Author: Stephen Richards,  Releasing You from Fear
Quote: When your back is to the wall and you are facing fear head on, the only way is forward and through it.

Author: Thisuri Wanniarachchi
Quote: Life is at its best when everything has fallen out of place, and you decide that you're going to fight to get them right, not when everything is going your way and everyone is praising you.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: A lot of the conflict you have in your life exists simply because you're not living in alignment; you're not be being true to yourself.

Author: Dorothy Parker
Quote: If I had a shiny gun I could have a world of fun Speeding bullets through the brains Of the folks that cause me pains :)

Author: Jane Austen,  Northanger Abbey
Quote: [I]t is well to have as many holds upon happiness as possible.

Author: Stephen Richards
Quote: Judgment is a negative frequency.

Author: Ingrid Bergman
Quote: Happiness is good health and a bad memory.

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: Live life as though nobody is watching, and express yourself as though everyone is listening.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: The victim mindset dilutes the human potential. By not accepting personal responsibility for our circumstances, we greatly reduce our power to change them.

Author: Boethius,  The Consolation of Philosophy
Quote: Nothing is miserable unless you think it so; and on the other hand, nothing brings happiness unless you are content with it.

Author: Wendy Wasserstein
Quote: The trick. . .is to find the balance between the bright colors of humor and the serious issues of identity, self-loathing, and the possibility for intimacy and love when it seems no longer possible or, sadder yet, no longer necessary.

Author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau,  The Social Contract and Discourses
Quote: Why should we build our happiness on the opinons of others, when we can find it in our own hearts?

Author: William Faulkner,  Absalom, Absalom!
Quote: If happy I can be I will, if suffer I must I can.

Author: مصطفى محمود,  الأحلام
Quote: الفرح الوحشي والمرح العنيف والضحك المجلجل حالات لا تدل على السعادة ، إنها تشنجات البؤساء الذين يريدون أن يأكدوا لأنفسهم وللناس أنهم يفرحون، يفرحون بشدة.

Author: Peter Deunov
Quote: Do not look for happiness outside yourself. The awakened seek happiness inside.

Author: Stephen Richards,  Think Your way to Success: Let Your Dreams Run Free
Quote: Success will be within your reach only when you start reaching out for it.

Author: Cristiano Ronaldo
Quote: I'm living a dream I never want to wake up from.

Author: Thisuri Wanniarachchi,  COLOMBO STREETS
Quote: Sometimes I wish life was written pencil so we could erase it and write it all over again.

Author: Stephen R. Covey,  The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change
Quote: Happiness, like unhappiness, is a proactive choice.

Author: John Chrysostom
Quote: Happiness can only be achieved by looking inward & learning to enjoy whatever life has and this requires transforming greed into gratitude.

Author: Sharon Swan
Quote: I'm a happy person. If you want to be around me, you can either choose to be happy too, or follow the signs to the nearest exit!

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: Her happiness floated like waves of ocean along the coast of her life. She found lyrics of her life in his arms but she never sung her song.

Author: Jeremy Bentham
Quote: Create all the happiness you are able to create; remove all the misery you are able to remove. Every day will allow you, --will invite you to add something to the pleasure of others, --or to diminish something of their pains.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Are you going to allow the world around you to change while you remain stagnant? Make this the time you throw away old habits that have hindered your happiness and success and finally allow your greatest self to flourish.

Author: Willa Cather,  My Ántonia
Quote: That is happiness; to be dissolved into something complete and great. When it comes to one, it comes as naturally as sleep.

Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables
Quote: The supreme happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves—say rather, loved in spite of ourselves.

Author: Colette
Quote: No one asked you to be happy. Get to work.

Author: Katherine Dunn,  Geek Love
Quote: Can you be happy with the movies, and the ads, and the clothes in the stores, and the doctors, and the eyes as you walk down the street all telling you there is something wrong with you? No. You cannot be happy. Because, you poor darling baby, you believe them.

Author: Stephen Fry,  Moab Is My Washpot
Quote: People who can change and change again are so much more reliable and happier than those who can’t

Author: Orhan Pamuk,  The Museum of Innocence
Quote: Any intelligent person knows that life is a beautiful thing and that the purpose of life is to be happy,"said my father as he watched the three beauties. "But it seems only idiots are ever happy. How can we explain this?

Author: Erin Hunter,  Fire and Ice
Quote: [Fireheart]mewed,"It's not my place to judge you."Greystripe looked up as Fireheart went on."Greystripe, whatever you decide to do, I will always be your friend.

Author: Jeremy Aldana
Quote: Insecurities have the ability to shape and mold our minds to live with everything that’s bad; like crying on the inside, while smiling on the outside…thus creating pain…but, alas, I have the answer; forget about what you thought and enjoy (embrace) what you feel

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: The more I understand the mind and the human experience, the more I begin to suspect there is no such thing as unhappiness; there is only ungratefulness.

Author: Will Rogers
Quote: Do the best you can, and don't take life too serious.

Author: Clint Eastwood
Quote: They say all marriages are made in heaven, but so are thunder and lightning.

Author: Rodolfo Costa,  Advice My Parents Gave Me: and Other Lessons I Learned from My Mistakes
Quote: Learn to love someone when they least deserve it, because that is when they need your love most.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Rant
Quote: The big reason why folks leave a small town,' Rant used to say, 'is so they can moon over the idea of going back. And the reason they stay put is so they can moon about getting out.'Rant meant that no one is happy, anywhere.

Author: Ken Kesey,  One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Quote: We'd just shared the last beer and slung the empty can out the window at a stop sign and were just waiting back to get the feel of the day, swimming in that kind of tasty drowsiness that comes over you after a day of going hard at something you enjoy doing -- half sunburned and half drunk and keeping awake only because you wanted to savor the taste as long as you could.

Author: Robert Browning
Quote: Love is the energy of life.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: When you are living the best version of yourself, you inspire others to live the best versions of themselves.

Author: Dean Koontz,  Life Expectancy
Quote: No one can grant you happiness. Happiness is a choice we all have the power to make.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: I still believe that peace and plenty and happiness can be worked out some way. I am a fool.

Author: Jack Johnson
Quote: We've got everything we need right here, and everything we need is enough.

Author: Graham Greene,  The Heart of the Matter
Quote: Point me out the happy man and I will point you out either extreme egotism, selfishness, evil -- or else an absolute ignorance.

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: Compassion is the signature of Higher Consciousness. Non-violence is the tool to evolve into the Higher Consciousness.

Author: Stephen Richards
Quote: Before you can successfully make friends with others, first you have to become your own friend.

Author: Anton Chekhov
Quote: Even in Siberia there is happiness.

Author: Emily Giffin,  Something Borrowed
Quote: We are one of those couples i used to watch, thinking to myself that I'd never be on the inside of something so special. I remember reassuring myself that it probably looked nicer than it actually was, I am happy to be wrong about that.

Author: Elizabeth Scott,  Bloom
Quote: Talking about someone who makes you happy actually makes you happy.

Author: Pete Wentz
Quote: The hardest thing about depression is that it is addictive. It begins to feel uncomfortable not to be depressed. You feel guilty for feeling happy.

Author: Henrik Ibsen,  A Doll's House
Quote: You see, there are some people that one loves, and others that perhaps one would rather be with.

Author: Jane Austen,  Emma
Quote: Why not seize the pleasure at once? -- How often is happiness destroyed by preparation, foolish preparation!

Author: Frank O'Hara
Quote: When I die, don't come, I wouldn't want a leafto turn away from the sun -- it loves it there.There's nothing so spiritual about being happybut you can't miss a day of it, because it doesn't last.

Author: Ilona Andrews,  Magic Bleeds
Quote: Everybody has something, that one thing they must do to feel happy. I think this is yours, and I want you to be happy. You don’t have to do it, but it’s here if you choose to come back to it.

Author: مصطفى لطفي المنفلوطي,  العبرات
Quote: لا أعرف أحداً بين الناس يستطيع أن يرسم لي خطة سعادتي كما أرسمها لنفسي

Author: Angela Morrison,  Sing Me to Sleep
Quote: I’d rather be miserable loving you than happy with anyone else.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Happiness is a state of mind, a choice, a way of living; it is not something to be achieved, it is something to be experienced.

Author: Cormac McCarthy,  No Country For Old Men
Quote: I think by the time you're grown you're as happy as you're goin to be. You'll have good times and bad times, but in the end you'll be about as happy as you was before. Or as unhappy. I've knowed people that just never did get the hang of it.

Author: Sigmund Freud
Quote: The intention that man should be happy is not in the plan of Creation.

Author: Stephen Richards,  Think Your way to Success: Let Your Dreams Run Free
Quote: Happiness is something we reap from the seeds we sow. Plant misery seeds and that us what you reap.

Author: David Levithan,  Nick & Norah's Infinite Playlist
Quote: ...because if you can make yourself happy in the rain then you're doing pretty alright in life.

Author: Albert Camus,  The Myth of Sisyphus and Other Essays
Quote: A man wants to earn money in order to be happy, and his whole effort and the best of a life are devoted to the earning of that money. Happiness is forgotten; the means are taken for the end.

Author: Ellen DeGeneres,  Seriously... I'm Kidding
Quote: The thing everyone should realize is that the key to happiness is being happy for yourself and yourself.

Author: Francine Rivers,  Redeeming Love
Quote: Mara, that's the life I want to give you. That's what I'm offering you. I want to fill you life with color and warmth. I want to fill it with light. Give me a chance

Author: Laini Taylor,  Dreams of Gods & Monsters
Quote: Happiness wasn't a mystical place to be reached or won--some bright terrain beyond the boundary of misery, a paradise waiting for them to find it--but something to carry doggedly with you through everything, as humble and ordinary as your gear and supplies.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: It is a kind of spiritual snobbery that makes people think they can be happy without money.

Author: George Alexiou
Quote: Friendship is thinking of the other person first.

Author: Deepak Chopra
Quote: The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.

Author: Megan McCafferty,  Second Helpings
Quote: I NEVER UNDERSTOOD THE POINT OF BEING SADWHEN I COULD CHOOSE TO BE HAPPY

Author: Ramana Maharshi
Quote: Happiness is your nature. It is not wrong to desire it. What is wrong is seeking it outside when it is inside.

Author: Guillaume Apollinaire
Quote: Joy came always after pain.

Author: George Alexiou
Quote: You and your purpose in life are the same thing. Your purpose is to be you.

Author: Ray Bradbury,  Fahrenheit 451
Quote: Are you happy?

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Your success and happiness lie in you.

Author: Socrates
Quote: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.

Author: Taylor Swift
Quote: Happiness and confidence are the prettiest things you can wear

Author: Dalai Lama XIV,  The Art of Happiness
Quote: Whether our action is wholesome or unwholesome depends on whether that action or deed arises from a disciplined or undisciplined state of mind. It is felt that a disciplined mind leads to happiness and an undisciplined mind leads to suffering, and in fact it is said that bringing about discipline within one's mind is the essence of the Buddha's teaching.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Every time I thought I was being rejected from something good, I was actually being re-directed to something better.

Author: David J. Pollay,  The Law of the Garbage Truck: How to Respond to People Who Dump on You, and How to Stop Dumping on Others
Quote: Many people are like garbage trucks. They run around full of garbage, full of frustration, full of anger, and full of disappointment. As their garbage piles up, they look for a place to dump it. And if you let them, they’ll dump it on you. So when someone wants to dump on you, don’t take it personally. Just smile, wave, wish them well, and move on. Believe me. You’ll be happier.

Author: Thomas Mann,  The Magic Mountain
Quote: Laughter is a sunbeam of the soul.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: The strength of a man isn't seen in the power of his arms. It's seen in the love with which he EMBRACES you.

Author: Casi McLean
Quote: The greatest thing about dreams is they don’t expire. They can lay dormant for years and when you pull them out and dust them off, they shine like new.

Author: Albert Camus,  The Plague
Quote: For who would dare to assert that eternal happiness can compensate for a single moment's human suffering

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: When you find yourself in need of spiritual nourishment, it is in the opportunities to serve others that you will find the abundance you seek.

Author: Desiderius Erasmus
Quote: The summit of happiness is reached when a person is ready to be what he is.

Author: J. Maarten Troost,  Getting Stoned with Savages: A Trip Through the Islands of Fiji and Vanuatu
Quote: Paradise was always over there, a day’s sail away. But it’s a funny thing, escapism. You can go far and wide and you can keep moving on and on through places and years, but you never escape your own life. I, finally, knew where my life belonged. Home.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: Take all that you can of this book upon reason, and the balance on faith, and you will live and die a happier man. (When a skeptic expressed surprise to see him reading a Bible)

Author: Alan Lightman,  Einstein's Dreams
Quote: The tragedy of this world is that no one is happy, whether stuck in a time of pain or joy.

Author: Janette Rallison
Quote: I've pursued dreams and achieved them, but I don't think anybody should think their life is incomplete if they don't follow some dream. Happiness doesn't come from achievements, or money, or any sort of treasure. Happiness is a frame of mind, not a destination. It's appreciating what you've got and building relationships with those around you.

Author: Napoleon Hill
Quote: Happiness is found in doing, not merely possessing.

Author: Leo Babauta
Quote: The point of simple living, for me has got to be:A soft place to landA wide margin of errorRoom to breatheLots of places to find baseline happiness in each and every day

Author: Elise Boulding
Quote: Frugality is one of the most beautiful and joyful words in the English language, and yet one that we are culturally cut off from understanding and enjoying. The consumption society has made us feel that happiness lies in having things, and has failed to teach us the happiness of not having things.

Author: Hugh Laurie
Quote: I would cling to unhappiness because it was a known, familiar state. When I was happier, it was because I knew I was on my way back to misery. I've never been convinced that happiness is the object of the game. I'm wary of happiness.

Author: Martha Washington
Quote: I've learned from experience that the greater part of our happiness or misery depends on our disposition and not on our circumstances.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: A flower blossoms for its own joy.

Author: Stephen Richards
Quote: It sometimes takes a state of solitude to bring to mind the real power of companionship.

Author: Ernestine Gilbreth Carey,  Belles on Their Toes
Quote: In a person's lifetime there may be not more than half a dozen occasions that he can look back to in the certain knowledge that right then, at that moment, there was room for nothing but happiness in his heart.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Life itself is simple...it's just not easy.

Author: Henry Miller,  Big Sur and the Oranges of Hieronymus Bosch
Quote: Surely every one realizes, at some point along the way, that he is capable of living a far better life than the one he has chosen.

Author: William Saroyan,  My Heart's in the Highlands
Quote: The greatest happiness you can have is knowing that you do not necessarily require happiness.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
