Quote: Culture is an elevated expression of the inner voice which the different peoples of the Earth have heard in the depths of their being, a voice which conveys the vibrant compassion and wisdom of the cosmic life. For different cultures to engage in interaction is to catalyze each other's souls and foster mutual understanding.

Author: Laura Munson,  This Is Not The Story You Think It Is...: A Season of Unlikely Happiness
Quote: Suffering sucks. Don't do it. Go home and love your wife. Go home and love yourself. Go homeand base your happiness on one thing and one thing only: freedom. Choose freedom, not suffering. Create a life of freedom, not wanting. Have some really good coffee and listen to the red-winged blackbirds in the marsh. Ignore the mosquitoes.

Author: David Gilmour,  The Film Club: A True Story of a Father and Son
Quote: It's about the quality of the worry,"I said. "I have happier worries now than I used to.

Author: Deborah Day
Quote: Nourishing yourself in a way that helps you blossom in the direction you want to go is attainable, and you are worth the effort.

Author: Louisa May Alcott,  Little Women
Quote: Well, I am happy, and I won't fret, but it does seem as if the more one gets the more one wants…

Author: Rasheed Ogunlaru
Quote: Live your life, sing your song. Not full of expectations. Not for the ovations. But for the joy of it.

Author: Brad Pitt
Quote: This idea of perpetual happiness is crazy and overrated, because those dark moments fuel you for the next bright moments; each one helps you appreciate the other.

Author: Charles Alexander Eastman
Quote: Children must early learn the the beauty of generosity. They are taught to give what they prize most, that they may taste the happiness of giving.

Author: Barry Schwartz
Quote: The secret to happiness is low expectations.

Author: Shan Sa,  The Girl Who Played Go
Quote: Happiness is something you lay siege to, it is a battle like a game of go. I will take hold of all the pain and snuff it out.

Author: Barbara Kingsolver
Quote: In Kilanga, people knew nothing of things they might have had - a Frigidaire? a washer-dryer combination? Really, they'd sooner imagine a tree that could pull up its feet and go bake bread. It didn't occur to them to feel sorry for themselves.

Author: Yvonne Pierre,  The Day My Soul Cried: A Memoir
Quote: It's not strength, it's PERCEPTION that makes you stronger. If you change how you SEE it, you'll change how you FEEL about it.

Author: William J. Bennett
Quote: Happiness is like a cat. If you try to coax it or call it, it will avoid you. It will never come. But if you pay no attention to it and go about your business, you'll find it rubbing up against your legs and jumping into your lap.

Author: Honoré de Balzac
Quote: And he, like many jaded people, had few pleasures left in life save good food and drink.

Author: Dorothy Day
Quote: When it comes down to it, even on the natural plane, it is much happier and more enlivening to love than to be loved.

Author: Andrew Weil
Quote: I think instead [of happiness] we should be working for contentment... an inner sense of fulfillment that's relatively independent of external circumstances.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Everything is easier said than done. Wanting something is easy. Saying something is easy. The challenge and the reward are in the doing.

Author: Orson Scott Card,  Sarah
Quote: Sometimes happiness consists of finding the right balance of misery.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Wedding
Quote: Frugality, I've learned, has its own cost, one that sometimes lasts forever.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: Mother earth cried so much that she has pool of tears more than the land of happiness.

Author: Jerry Spinelli,  Milkweed
Quote: He tapped my chest. 'Happy is here.' He tapped his own chest. 'Here.'I looked down past my chin. 'Inside?''Inside.'It was getting crowded in there. First angel. Now happy. It seemed there was more to me than cabbage and turnips.

Author: Francesca Lia Block,  Blood Roses
Quote: You are so intense. Like a storm. It's shocking how intense you are.

Author: Todd Stocker,  Refined: Turning Pain Into Purpose
Quote: Helping others is the secret sauce to a happy life.

Author: يوسف القرضاوي
Quote: السعادة شيء ينبع من داخل الإنسان ولا يستورد من خارجه، وإذا كانت السعادة شجرة منبتها النفس البشرية والقلب الإنساني، فإن الإيمان بالله والدار الآخرة هو ماؤها.. وغذائها.. وهوائها.. وضياؤها

Author: Temitope Owosela
Quote: If you want good luck; you must go out there and search for that luck!! Because luck is waiting for you to look for it.

Author: Adam Silvera,  More Happy Than Not
Quote: Sometimes pain is so unmanageable that the idea of spending another day with it seems impossible. Other times pain acts as a compass to help you get through the messier tunnels of growing up. But the pain can only help you find happiness if you can remember it.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: The moon is the reflection of your heart and moonlight is the twinkle of your love.

Author: André Maurois,  Climats
Quote: Happiness is never there to stay [...] Happiness is merely a respite offered by inquietude.

Author: Dan Savage
Quote: How can you tell somebody who is pursuing happiness that they're somehow not American when that was the very first promise that America made?

Author: Graham Greene,  Loser Takes All
Quote: She was not too young to be wise, but she was too young to know that wisdom shouldn't be spoken aloud when you are happy.

Author: Horace Walpole,  The Castle of Otranto
Quote: He was persuaded he could know no happiness but in the society of one with whom he could for ever indulge the melancholy that had taken possession of his soul.

Author: Tom Robbins
Quote: It is more important to be free than to be happy.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: You are the point of origin for everything in your world: you set the standard for yourself.

Author: Jesse Browner
Quote: We are all doomed to seek our own happiness; we can't help ourselves. We are all, the cruel and the gentle alike, condemned to seeking that happiness in the dark. We use our need as the blind use a walking stick, to determine the safety of every forward step.

Author: Lawrence Durrell,  The Alexandria Quartet
Quote: You see, nothing matters except pleasure - which is the opposite of happiness, its tragic part, I expect.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath
Quote: How can I tell Bob that my happiness streams from having wrenched a piece out of my life, a piece of hurt and beauty, and transformed it to typewritten words on paper? How can he know I am justifying my life, my keen emotions, my feeling, by turning it into print?

Author: Euripides
Quote: The man is happiest who lives from day to day and asks no more, garnering the simple goodness of life.

Author: Shunryu Suzuki
Quote: Christopher McCandless:"I will miss you too, but you are wrong if you think that the joy of life comes principally from the joy of human relationships. God's place is all around us, it is in everything and in anything we can experience. People just need to change the way they look at things.

Author: Mary Balogh,  Simply Magic
Quote: There is no happily-ever-after to run to. We have to work for happiness.

Author: Geneen Roth
Quote: Most of our suffering comes from resisting what is already here, particularly our feelings. All any feeling wants is to be welcomed, touched, allowed. It wants attention. It wants kindness. If you treated your feelings with as much love as you treated your dog or your cat or your child, you'd feel as if you were living in heaven every day of your sweet life.

Author: Kristi Bowman
Quote: The key to ultimate happiness and fulfillment lies within our own transformation. The more we learn and grow and evolve as individuals, the more we will find happiness and satisfaction in relationships, work and life.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Duino Elegies
Quote: But suppose the endlessly dead were to wake in us some emblem:they might point to the catkins hangingfrom the empty hazel trees, or direct us to the raindescending on black earth in early  spring. ---And we, who always think of happinessrising, would feel the emotionthat almost baffles uswhen a happy thing falls.

Author: Markelle Grabo,  The Elf Girl
Quote: I hate going through this when we just found...,"his voice trailed off."Found what?""Each other,"he finished, half-smiling.

Author: Laura Hillenbrand,  Unbroken: A World War II Story of Survival, Resilience, and Redemption
Quote: I am in an altogether new world now. I can think of nothing more wonderful. It is a real touch of all that heaven means.

Author: Sanober Khan,  Turquoise Silence
Quote: ...so i will greet youin a wayall loved thingsare meant to be greetedwith a tear in my heartand a poem in my eye.

Author: Dan Buettner,  Thrive: Finding Happiness the Blue Zones Way
Quote: Gratitude always comes into play; research shows that people are happier if they are grateful for the positive things in their lives, rather than worrying about what might be missing.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: The purpose of empowerment is to urge you towards freedom, to help each of you to break free of all limitations. It is that freedom that will give you eternal happiness and finally connect you with the unconditional realization of TRUTH.

Author: Urania Sarri,  Gate Deadlock
Quote: Some people would rather live in a hell they've got used to than in a paradise they've never experienced before.

Author: Lorraine Zago Rosenthal,  Other Words for Love
Quote: She was wearing her fuzzy pink hat and she was happy, which was so obnoxious. She'd become one of those people who waltzed through life without so much as a split end, and I was still one of those people who changed diapers for free but still got treated like a rented mule.

Author: Charles Caleb Colton
Quote: Men spend their lives in anticipations,—in determining to be vastly happy at some period when they have time. But the present time has one advantage over every other—it is our own. Past opportunities are gone, future have not come. We may lay in a stock of pleasures, as we would lay in a stock of wine; but if we defer the tasting of them too long, we shall find that both are soured by age.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: I enjoy melancholic music and art. They take me to places I don't normally get to go.

Author: Jennifer O'Neill,  Soul DNA: Your Spiritual Genetic Code Defines Your Purpose
Quote: Unhappiness can be like a virus spreading from one person, to the next person, to the next one and so on. When someone is mean or rude to you, do not let their unhappiness infect your own life. If you are the unhappy one, please quarantine yourself so you do not infect others!

Author: David Lee Roth
Quote: Money can't buy happiness but it can buy a huge yacht that sails right next to it.

Author: Anne-Laure Bondoux,  The Killer's Tears
Quote: If there was one thing that life has taught me, it’s to accept the most foolish and unthinkable happiness.

Author: John Burroughs
Quote: The secret of happiness is something to do

Author: Albert Camus,  A Happy Death
Quote: There's the risk of being loved...and that would keep me from being happy.

Author: Katherine Hannigan,  Emmaline and the Bunny
Quote: And all the best words together couldn't hold the happiness.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  Trouble
Quote: [Poem: Slates of Grey]Sullen faces like slates of grey—What I’d seen on a walk today.Bodies rushing bodies boltingTime for life a disregarding.Money to make and to grow oldWhat about the hands to hold?Deadlines, projects, people to meetWhat about our own two feet.Sullen faces like slates of grey...What I’d see most anyday.

Author: CrimethInc.,  Expect Resistance: A Field Manual
Quote: A truly radical resolution would be to embrace existence just as it is, as the only thing that matters, to proclaim that the world itself is heaven, made for our total enjoyment and fulfillment...

Author: Jennifer Donnelly,  Revolution
Quote: The greenest of pastures are right here on earth.

Author: Karen Maezen Miller,  Hand Wash Cold: Care Instructions for an Ordinary Life
Quote: Happiness is simple. Everything we do to find it is complicated.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: Happiness will grow if you plant the seeds of love in the garden of hope with compassion and care.

Author: Kij Johnson,  The Fox Woman
Quote: Happiness is the pleasantest of emotions; because of this, it is the most dangerous. Having once felt happiness, one will do anything to maintain it, and losing it, one will grieve.

Author: Ogwo David Emenike
Quote: Happy is the soul that has a friend. Happier is the soul that trusts in the truth of the heart of a friend. Happiest is the soul that knows the solemnity of friendship and honours its laws.

Author: Wayne Coyne
Quote: Try to be happy within the context of the life we are actually living. Happiness is not a situation to be longed for or a convergence of lucky happenstance. Through the power of our own minds, we can help ourselves.

Author: Robert Holden,  Happiness Now!: Timeless Wisdom for Feeling Good FAST
Quote: Happiness is not in things; happiness is in you.

Author: Lionel Shriver,  We Need to Talk About Kevin
Quote: Not that happiness is dull. Only that it doesn't tell well. And of our consuming diversions as we age is to recite, not only to others but to ourselves, our own story.

Author: Tony Meloto (Your First Job by: N. Dy)
Quote: If you really want to be happy, don't just go for the money. Go for the relationship that lasts. Go for things of greater value.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Best of Me
Quote: I've never been afraid of them. Not once. Because I had you.

Author: Sonia Rumzi
Quote: It is not where we are that matters nor what we have, it is what we do with where we are and what we have.

Author: Thisuri Wanniarachchi
Quote: The thing about life is, you’ve got to somehow make it through the day. Don’t wait for the beautiful evening. Go on with your life. Of course, the beautiful evening will come. In fact, she’s on her way. And she’s coming to you as fast as she can. And dude, she’s beautiful.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: Be like a branch of a tree; flex your body to face 'wind of sorrow'; flex little harder to dance in the 'wind of happiness'.

Author: Joshua Kai,  The Quantum Prayer: An Inspiring Guide to Love, Healing, and Creating the Best Life Possible
Quote: Even the smallest shift in perspective can bring about the greatest healing.

Author: Carol Shields,  Unless
Quote: Happiness is the lucky pane of glass you carry in your head. It takes all your cunning just to hang on to it, and once it's smashed you have to move into a different sort of life.

Author: Bill Vaughan
Quote: Money won't buy happiness, but it will pay the salaries of a huge research staff to study the problem.

Author: Robert Holden
Quote: Whoever said happiness needs a plan?

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  Night Flight
Quote: Action and personal happiness have no truck with each other; they are eternally at war.

Author: Michel de Montaigne
Quote: There is indeed a certain sense of gratification when we do a good deed that gives us inward satisfaction, and a generous pride that accompanies a good conscience…These testimonies of a good conscience are pleasant; and such a natural pleasure is very beneficial to us; it is the only payment that can never fail. “On Repentance

Author: Sri Chinmoy
Quote: You must never forget that greatness does not guarantee happiness but goodness always does

Author: Hermann Hesse,  The Glass Bead Game
Quote: The old man slowly raised himself from the piano stool, fixed those cheerful blue eyes piercingly and at the same time with unimaginable friendliness upon him, and said: "Making music together is the best way for two people to become friends. There is none easier. That is a fine thing. I hope you and I shall remain friends. Perhaps you too will learn how to make fugues, Joseph.

Author: Ibuki Haneda,  Koizora (Love Sky), Volume 1
Quote: Tatsuya: What you have "right now"won't necessarily continue on until forever...Hiro: ... Yeah, I know.

Author: Claire Chilton
Quote: The secret to happiness is the journey, not the destination.

Author: James Hopwood Jeans
Quote: The really happy person is the one who can enjoy the scenery, even when they have to take a detour.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: We need more than just the Law of Attraction. We need to connect with its more successful twin, the Law of Generosity. And further entwine ourselves with their parent; the Law of Love.

Author: John Green,  Will Grayson, Will Grayson
Quote: he is both the source of my happiness and the one i want to share it with. i have to believe that’s a sign.

Author: Amy Lane,  Truth in the Dark
Quote: I was terrified of my weakness, of my sharp tongue, ofmy every flaw. I was terrified that this moment, my chance tolive in happiness for however short a time we may have had,would be ruined because I was simply not carved out of thesame wood as happiness, and that my grain was too twistedto ever take its form.

Author: Ivan Turgenev
Quote: We’re young, we’re not monsters, no fools: we’ll conquer happiness for ourselves.

Author: Audrey Niffenegger,  The Time Traveler's Wife
Quote: I think about my mother singing after lunch on a Summer afternoon, twirling in blue dress across the floor of her dressing room

Author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana
Quote: Separate yourself from those who hinder your vision. Make a choice to walk away from the trap set to ensnare you. Realize when someone is pulling you backwards every time you take a step forward. Separate from them and the result of your action will be a life of success.

Author: Richelle E. Goodrich,  Smile Anyway: Quotes, Verse, & Grumblings for Every Day of the Year
Quote: It's not my job to make you happy. It's your job to learn that only those who quit selfishly seeking their own happiness find it.

Author: Sebastian Barry,  The Secret Scripture
Quote: It is always worth itemising happiness, there is so much of the other thing in a life, you had better put down the markers for happiness while you can.

Author: Günter Grass
Quote: An empty bus hurtles through the starry nightPerhaps the driver is singingand happy because he sings.

Author: Lin Yutang,  The Importance of Living
Quote: If one's bowels move, one is happy, and if they don't move, one is unhappy. That is all there is to it.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: The universe never complains.When you're wrong or right,She always loves and cares,She always gives and shares. When you get lost she becomes the light,Helps you to find what is right. But she never forgetsTo show you the light.

Author: C.P. Snow
Quote: The pursuit of happiness is a most ridiculous phrase; if you pursue happiness you'll never find it.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: To fill the hour──that is happiness.

Author: Megan Whalen Turner,  A Conspiracy of Kings
Quote: I wonder if people always choose what will make them unhappy.

Author: Jennifer O'Neill,  The Pursuit of Happiness: 21 Spiritual Rules to Sucess
Quote: Blaming is so much easier than taking responsibility, because if you take responsibility … then you might be to blame.

Author: Tim Willocks,  The Religion
Quote: Sadness is never bad,"said Amparo. "Sadness is the mirror of being happy

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne's House of Dreams
Quote: Oh, Marilla, I thought I was happy before. Now I know that I just dreamed a pleasant dream of happiness. This is the reality.

Author: Francesca Lia Block,  Blood Roses
Quote: It was always a relief when she came home to him. Like water or food. Like music or that moment when you cut yourself with a knife and squeeze the skin and no blood oozes out.

Author: Jane Austen,  Emma
Quote: How often is happiness destroyed by preparation, foolish preparation!

Author: Yevgeny Zamyatin,  We
Quote: Happiness without freedom, or freedom without happiness. There was no third alternative.

Author: Lauren Oliver,  Before I Fall
Quote: God bless Dunkin' Donuts.

Author: J.T.Abraham
Quote: Future is one of the wildest experiences that you will ever have.

Author: Epicurus
Quote: If you wish to make Pythocles rich, do not add to his store of money, but subtract from his desires.

Author: Michael Bassey Johnson
Quote: Don't show a friend your gift, or your bag of money if you still want to maintain your relationship, but if nay, go on, and all you'll see is hate and jealousy, and you'll fight with him in the street like a dog and all you'll feel is regret.

Author: Peter Heller,  The Dog Stars
Quote: I think now that maybe true sweetness can only happen in limbo.

Author: Mata Amritanandamayi
Quote: True happiness is when the love that is within us finds expression in external activities.

Author: Patrick Rothfuss,  The Wise Man's Fear
Quote: There can be many opinions on a thing, but there is only one truth."Vashet smiled lazily. "And if the pursuit of the truth was my goal, that would concern me."She gave a long yawn, stretching like a happy cat. "Instead I will focus on the joy in my heart, [...}

Author: Margaret Peterson Haddix,  Among the Brave
Quote: And Nedley started saying,'Shut Up!Quit that! And i knew it really meant something to him. So I asked for his help,"Mark said. "Don't tell the story like that,"Nedley laughed. "What he said was 'Quit pretendin you're a bad guy I need your help, and I need it now!

Author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett,  Friends 2 Lovers: The Unthinkable
Quote: Nurturing, Providing, and loving you passionately. May that be, my number of responsibilities. As one to the end, forever more. That's how long I desire, our love to last for. Providing for you many and joyful memories. In hours of darkness, as well as brightness. I plan to supply for you. For your love for me and happiness, is all that matters to me.

Author: Josef Pieper,  Happiness and Contemplation
Quote: Happiness,... even the smallest happiness, is like a step out of Time, and the greatest happiness is sharing in Eternity.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: It is in the balancing of your spirituality with your humanity that you will find immeasurable happiness, success, good health, and love.

Author: Thomas Merton,  No Man Is an Island
Quote: True happiness is not found in any other reward than that of being united with God. If I seek some other reward besides God Himself, I may get my reward but I cannot be happy.

Author: Steve Goodier
Quote: It’s true that laughter really is cheap medicine. It’s a prescription anyone can afford. And best of all, you can fill it right now.

Author: Robert Nozick,  Examined Life: Philosophical Meditations
Quote: And although it might be best of all to be Socrates satisfied, having both happiness and depth, we would give up some happiness in order to gain the depth.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: The secret of happiness is love and secret of love is nonjudgmental care.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: Share your love, share you happiness, care for others; your wealth will be endless.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: A friend is a friend who continues to love you and like you when you don't love him or like him any more.

Author: Graham Greene,  A Gun for Sale
Quote: She couldn't avoid being serious about things she cared for, and happiness made her grave at the thought of all the things which might destroy it.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Your success and happiness lies in you. Resolve to keep happy, and your joy and you shall form an invicible host against difficulties.

Author: Bangambiki Habyarimana,  The Great Pearl of Wisdom
Quote: If people were employed at creating heaven on earth, everybody would be happy; instead each one is creating his own heaven by creating hell for others.

Author: Andrew Weil
Quote: The notion that a human being should be constantly happy is a uniquely modern, uniquely American, uniquely destructive idea.

Author: Thisuri Wanniarachchi,  COLOMBO STREETS
Quote: I know money isn't everything. but it certainly is something.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Imagination doesn't always make you long for what you cannot have, but rather thrive in what you do not have.

Author: Deborah Day,  BE HAPPY NOW!
Quote: The best way to insure you achieve the greatest satisfaction out of life is to behave intentionally.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: You would not be here TODAY if YESTERDAY was your defining moment. LIVE THIS DAY and move towards your dreams.

Author: Robert Holden,  Happiness Now!: Timeless Wisdom for Feeling Good FAST
Quote: Nothing in the world can make you happy; everything in the world can encourage you to be happy

Author: Melissa Nathan,  Persuading Annie
Quote: A lifetime of lonely regret or happiness with some pain along the way.

Author: Vijay Dhameliya
Quote: Expect more get less and feel sadness Or expect less get more and feel happiness

Author: George Alexiou
Quote: Nothing that happens to you was meant to be. The only thing about you that was meant to be is you. Blaze your own trail.

Author: Salvatore Scibona
Quote: Reading messed with my brain in an unaccountable way. It made me happy; or something.

Author: Daniel C. Dennett
Quote: The secret of happiness: Find something more important than you are and dedicate your life to it.

Author: Amit Abraham
Quote: Happy are those who evolve from within.

Author: John Newton
Quote: The midsummer sun shines but dim, The fields strive in vain to look gay; But when I am happy in Him December's as pleasant as May.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: You are happy when you are enthusiastic and action-oriented, not when you are luxury and pleasure oriented.

Author: John Fowles
Quote: We talked for hours. He talked and I listened. It was like wind and sunlight. It blew all the cobwebs away.

Author: Giacomo Casanova,  The Story of My Life
Quote: There is no such thing as a perfectly happy or perfectly unhappy man in the world. One has more happiness in his life and another more unhappiness, and the same circumstance may produce widely different effects on individuals of different temperaments.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: It was not in me It came and wentI wanted to hold it It was held by wine(I no longer know what it was)

Author: Colette
Quote: Be happy. It's one way of being wise

Author: Ogwo David Emenike,  Happiness Recipe: Eat and Stay Happy
Quote: To be happy, you have to risk being unhappy.

Author: Jules Renard,  The Journal of Jules Renard
Quote: If one were to build the house of happiness, the largest space would be the waiting room.

Author: Prem Prakash,  The Yoga of Spiritual Devotion A Modern Translation of the Narada Bhakti Sutras
Quote: If one’s life is so unsatisfying that an unhealthy activity brings a shred of happiness, it is nigh impossible to give it up unless something that brings greater happiness can be enjoyed in its stead. (28)

Author: CrimethInc.,  Evasion
Quote: We left behind the other kids; their path-working, drinking, and being grown up- and rejected all that made them grumpy, uncreative and lifeless. We dumpstered, squatted, and shoplifted our lives back. Everything fell into place when we decided our lives were meant to be lived. Life serves the risk taker...

Author: Jeanette Winterson,  Why Be Happy When You Could Be Normal?
Quote: Our own front door can be a wonderful thing, or a sight we dread; rarely is it only a door.

Author: Jim Fergus,  One Thousand White Women: The Journals of May Dodd
Quote: that's exactly the good thing about the Injun life--you don't have to stop and think about whether or not you're 'happy'--which in my opinionis a highly overrated human condition invented by white folks

Author: Rachel Machacek,  The Science of Single: One Woman's Grand Experiment in Modern Dating, Creating Chemistry, and Finding L ove
Quote: I'm generally a happy person -with the help of antidepressants, that is- so there is something to be said for surrounding myself with happy people.

Author: Anne Giardini,  The Sad Truth About Happiness
Quote: I used to float along in all of this, like a leaf on a coursing stream, but i am heavier now, less easily moved, more resolute and steadfast. I am no longer in pursuit of happiness. As I stand here at my front door, key in hand, I think it is just possible that happiness, at least for now, today, this hour, may be in pursuit of me.

Author: Habeeb Akande
Quote: It is sad that people need alcohol to make them happy.

Author: Edith Wharton,  Ethan Frome and Other Short Fiction
Quote: There are lots of ways of being miserable, but there’s only one way of being comfortable, and that is to stop running round after happiness. If you make up your mind not to be happy there’s no reason why you shouldn’t have a fairly good time.

Author: Paul Ian Guillermo
Quote: if you feel happy, Smile with all your heart. if you're down, smile with all your might.

Author: ياسمين ثابت,  آشيا
Quote: هكذا يأتي الفرح فجأة ولا نكون أبدا متأنقين لاستقباله

Author: Daniel Clausen,  Ghosts of Nagasaki: Silence
Quote: Sometimes I think if we didn’t have these problems the whole world would stop spinning on her axis, we’d all stop spinning on our axises, axes, or whatever you want to call them, and then we’d have to settle into the nasty business of finding a way to be happy.

Author: Toba Beta
Quote: Smartass Disciple: Master, what is the secret recipe of your happiness?Master of Stupidity: If I tell you, there is nobody left to be made fun of.

Author: Sharon Shinn,  Summers at Castle Auburn
Quote: But I am king. And the well-being of my kingdom depends on my sound judgment and clear head. And those things depend on my state of happiness. And I have known for a long time that my state of happiness depends on you.

Author: Mohammed Naseehu Ali,  The Prophet of Zongo Street: Stories
Quote: The only means by which one could attain complete happiness is to avoid living in constant expectation of it. It's the expectation that causes our unhappiness and consequent bitterness about life

Author: Toba Beta,  My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut
Quote: Happiness earned, not given.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Dear John
Quote: الحب يعني أن تهتم بسعادة شخص آخر أكثر من اهتمامك بسعادتك أنت ، بغض النظر عن مدى الألم الذي سيسببه لك قرارك

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: When life gives you pain, accept it. When life gives you happiness, reject it.

Author: Mary Balogh,  More Than a Mistress
Quote: Why do I want to run from happiness?

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche,  On the Advantage and Disadvantage of History for Life
Quote: Happiness: being able to forget or, to express in a more learned fashion.

Author: Samuel Gordon
Quote: Joy is distinctly a Christian word and a Christian thing. It is the reverse of happiness. Happiness is the result of what happens of an agreeable sort. Joy has its spring deep down inside. And that spring never runs dry, no matter what happens. Only Jesus gives that joy.

Author: Louis Zukofsky,  Collected Fiction
Quote: It was a pity that people did not risk enough to speak out in behalf of one another's happiness and their own.

Author: Zaeema J. Hussain,  The Sky Is Purple
Quote: We thought everything would be forgotten, but I still remember yourclaws running down my back.I wonder if you still think about us,the way I do.How our legs would crash into each other in the middle of the night, and how we endedup creating the moon in the confines of our beds.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Quote: Comparison is the thief of joy.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Joy is the holy fire that keeps our purpose warm and our intelligence aglow.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: Happiness is a good business these days, more you talk crap about happiness the large number of crowd you will gather.

Author: Ray Bradbury
Quote: We are living in a time when flowers are trying to live on flowers, instead of on good rain and black loam.

Author: Ogwo David Emenike,  Happiness Recipe: Eat and Stay Happy
Quote: Like love, like talent, like any other virtue, like anything else in this life, happiness needs to be nurtured - this is the truth of the whole matter.

Author: Millard Kaufman,  Bowl of Cherries
Quote: Happiness when sustained too long in print can rightly be construed as sappiness...

Author: Diana Rose Morcilla
Quote: Dreams. They start in your beautiful mind. Think of beautiful things and it will manifest into actions because your body will listen to you. Like it always does.

Author: Orhan Pamuk,  The Innocence of Objects
Quote: The greatest happiness is when the eye discovers beauty where neither then mind conceived of nor the hand intended any.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Days of Yay are Here! Wake Me Up When They're Over.
Quote: Are you happy here with me? Because if not, we can scoot over a few feet.

Author: E. Nesbit,  The Magic World
Quote: So he caught her in his arms and kissed her, and they were very happy, and told each other what a beautiful world it was, and how wonderful it was that they should have found each other, seeing that the world is not only beautiful but rather large.

Author: Leslie Caron
Quote: In order to have great happiness, you have to have great pain and unhappiness-otherwise how would you know when you're happy?

Author: Alexis Jordan
Quote: Through strength I found loveIn time I found myself in happiness with you

Author: Bryan Cohen,  The Post-College Guide to Happiness
Quote: If you love a person, you should show it in adundance, not reserve it for special occasions like fine china.

Author: Yongey Mingyur,  The Joy of Living: Unlocking the Secret and Science of Happiness
Quote: Ultimately, happiness comes down to choosing between the discomfort of becoming aware of your mental afflictions and the discomfort of being ruled by them.

Author: Laura Fitzgerald,  Veil of Roses
Quote: As I watch him, a sudden recognition comes over me: Tonight, I can be anyone I want… maybe being happy only means living in the moment, appreciating the exact moment you're in and not thinking about the worries of the future.

Author: Marisa de los Santos,  Belong to Me
Quote: I know how syrupy this sounds, how dull, provincial, and possibly whitewashed, but what can I do? Happy childhoods happen

Author: Kelly Epperson
Quote: I surround myself with things that make me happy. Why? Because ... it makes me happy.

Author: Sonya Watson,  The Tide Breaker
Quote: I wished upon a star and the heavens sent me you

Author: Jane Austen,  Mansfield Park
Quote: He will make you happy, Fanny; I know he will make you happy; but you will make him everything.

Author: Holly Hood,  Prison of Paradise
Quote: People expected something for nothing, that’s why they did nothing so beautifully these days.

Author: H.P. Lovecraft
Quote: I neither knew nor cared whether my experience was insanity, dreaming, or magic; but was determined to gaze on brilliance and gaiety at any cost.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: Happiness consists in always aspiring perfection, the pause in any level in perfection is the pause of happiness

Author: Alcibiades
Quote: As contraries are known by contraries, so is the delights of presence best known by the torments of absence.

Author: Michael Bassey Johnson
Quote: The more death, the more birth. People are entering, others are exiting. The cry of a baby, the mourning of others. When others cry, the other are laughing and making merry. The world is mingled with sadness, joy, happiness, anger, wealth, poverty, etc.

Author: Omaid olovejlj Zazai
Quote: I have been poisoned in your love and now I need antidote Jacqueline.L.J! <3

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: If life throws you a few bad notes or vibrations, don't let them interrupt or alter your song.

Author: Barbara Barrington Jones
Quote: Many of us seem to live our lives looking for happiness. That is not always a bad thing, but it can be if we continually believe that happiness is someplace else and not in the present.

Author: Dwain K. White Sr.,  Every Woman's Dream
Quote: For a woman to deny the necessity of true love in her life would be to deny herself, and her creator.

Author: Michael Bassey Johnson
Quote: Merry hearts are vulnerable to death, don't be over-joyed to the state of oblivion, lest the enemy poison your meal.

Author: Nancy J. Cavanaugh,  This Journal Belongs to Ratchet
Quote: A FriendSomeoneYou're happy to see,Who's happy to see you.SomeoneYou like for who they areNot just for what they can do for you.

Author: Mike Rowe
Quote: Happiness does not come from a job. It comes from knowing what you truly value, and behaving in a way that’s consistent with those beliefs.

Author: Lynda Williams,  Holy war
Quote: The happiness of a family is such a complex matter. Like a table laid out with a tea service, it looks so ordinary until it's threatened. Then it becomes infinitely precious.

Author: Elyne Mitchell,  Moon Filly
Quote: Here, also, the future was cried aloud by the wind through the rocks, so that all those who heard would shiver, and then the liquid spring song of the thrush would make all the beauty of moonlight and sunlight blend together, making it true, so true, that happiness must come again
